author: Special Correspondent
text:
After launching signature campaigns in colleges to motivate students and new voters to cast their votes in the May 16 Assembly elections, District Election Officer and Collector S. Natarajan joined hands with general public to form a human chain as part of the SVEEP (Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation) activity.

Stepping up the SVEEP activity, Mr. Natarajan flagged off an election awareness rally, taken out by the general public at S. Tharaikudi in Kadaladi block. The rally was organised by Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Department. The participants carried placards underlining the importance of voters discharging their democratic duty by casting their votes in the election.

Later, the Collector joined hands with the general public at Sevalpatti village in the same block and formed a human chain to create voters’ awareness. Later, he administered voters’ awareness pledge to the people.

“We are focussing on low-polled areas in the previous elections and stepping up the SVEEP activity to substantially increase the poll percentage,” he said. They were working towards achieving 100 per cent polling in four Assembly segments in the district, he added.

In another programme at the new bus stand here, the Collector flagged off a rally taken out by anganwadi workers.

The rally was organised by the Department of Integrated Child Development Services scheme.
title: Drive to raise polling percentage
